name: Premier Inn Dover - A20

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: From the off the staff were friendly, helpful and professional .
reviews.title: Ideal one night stop before channel crossing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the price this was a good choice. Quiet environment which meant a good night's sleep
reviews.title: Excellent Premier Inn - A great option in Dover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Before our journey to France
reviews.title: Really enjoyable state & great restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Beefeater restaurant next door was well worth booking. Had an excellent breakfast ( if you like porridge then the portion is huge)
reviews.title: A Good Stopping Off Point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The dinner was very good value for money and they were so helpful and supportive of my 17 month grand daughter who is a social beaver and loves her food.
reviews.title: Good Value,Ideal for ferry/tunnel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed just one night before taking the ferry to France the following morning. I think the biggest drawback to this particular hotel is its location. It is outside Dover and the only facility within walking distance is the Beefeater restaurant adjacent to the hotel. The food there was good, even above average, but there is nothing else to do in the immediate area.
reviews.title: Not as good as we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Bottom line: If you're looking for a quick meal and night's sleep, this will do.
reviews.title: Would have been 1 star, but for the refund.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night to break up the road trip back from Europe. it was slightly cheaper than the Premier Inn near the ferry terminal and didn't look nearly as grotty. (It actually looked quite nice).
reviews.title: Nice for a stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was so hot we couldn't sleep. Being on a main road meant when we opened the windows to let in some air, we had the traffic noise to contend with.
reviews.title: Perfect to stop over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom hadn't been properly cleaned and absolutely stank of urine. The carpets hadn't been properly cleaned either in the areas you don't walk on. Loads of dust and grime under the bed and in all the places our one year old child loves to crawl. There was no mattress in the child cot. I don't imagine they'd expect an adult guest to sleep on a rock hard surface. Luckily we had our own cot bedding and mattress to use instead.
reviews.title: Ideal option to explore the area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: Stayed over prior to an early ferry. Only gripe is booked a double room and got allocated a disabled room and weren't made aware, but to be fair think that's an issue with the agent I booked thought and not directly premier inn. When I arrived, at around midnight night receptionist (male) was very friendly and helpful. Booked in quickly and even printed off a map to port. Room was clean and well presented if alittle dated. Checked out at 10am. All fine. Had breakfast in attached beefeater diner. Good breakfast and service. All good really. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Seen the previous reviews but disagree.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stopped here for 1 night before getting an early ferry. Being a wheelchair user its always hit and miss but this was a hit. The room was perfect, it was clean comfortable and I slept very well.
reviews.title: Stop over before early ferry

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Had a meal in the Beefeater right next door which was great value for money.
reviews.title: overnight stay before going to eurotunnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stop to get that early ferry and will be booking again for October this year too.
reviews.title: Diabolical Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: had a very good meal at restaurant attached to premier inn, staff were all friendly and polite, had a lovely overnight stay and very good value. would definitely look at staying at premier inn in the future
reviews.title: Dated, uncomfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed on both outward and return journey. The rooms were very good and had excellent facilities. The only two problems we would highlight was the extractor fans in the bathroom were very noisy and when we highlighted this the receptionist came up and tried to quieten it down, but there was still a low hum, which was annoying when aware. the door closed helped but when ur aware.!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Great stopover hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second was the showers, although warm the flow was more a trickle.
reviews.title: Ferry stopover

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything else about this hotel was very good.
reviews.title: Friendly Staff and Clean, Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Due to traffic problems we didn't arrive until 9.45 pm (4 hrs sat on the m25) so we were really ready for a good nights sleep which we got. The check in was very quick and we went straight to the beefeater to eat,the food was quickly served and was very good despite the time of night. The breakfast the next morning was also very good. We will stay in this hotel again when using the ferry. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable which are the main things on an overnighter.
reviews.title: Great hotel very handy for the ferry and great for families

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a particularly friendly welcome and helpful receptionist called Gina. The room was clean, fresh and comfortable. The weather was extremely warm over the 2 days we were there, so we left the window open, however the noise of the traffic could be heard then. Fortunately the hotel provides fans, but nothing beats an air.con room when it's hot. Also we booked a meal deal and breakfast in the Restaurant next door, (Beefeaters) The first night was really good, the service was excellent and the food was surprisingly good. We had steak and it was very tender. However the next day the experience wasn't so good, different team serving and probably different chef. The restaurant is very tired and shabby looking, I think it has seen better days. We were really looking forward to the nice breakfasts that we've experience before, but was let down a bit by the lay-out and the display of the breakfast. It wasn't very appealing. But the food was okay. Overall I would recommend it as a stopover.
reviews.title: Budget Accommodation for Joining Ship

description: Located just outside Dover in the Kent Countryside, this hotel is the perfect relaxing stop off on your way to or from Continental Europe. Less than 4 miles from the Ferry Terminal, it is ideally located for those wishing to stay before catching an early ferry or after returning late on an evening sailing.Dover (A20) Premier Inn is conveniently located just off the A20 between Dover and Folkestone and provides a great base for exploring the surrounding area. Not only are there some great sights such as Dover Castle and the lovely Dover Beach within close reach, but the beautiful Cathedral City of Canterbury is only half an hour's drive away.Refurbished in 2011, we offer clean and comfortable rooms, a Beefeater Grill Restaurant and Bar and all the amenities you would expect from Premier Inn - not to mention a welcoming and helpful team on duty for you 24hrs a day.Here at Premier Inn Dover (A20) we are so confident in what we have to offer you that we guarantee you will have a good night's sleep - or your money back! (Terms and Conditions Apply).
